comments.body:
Project link is incorrect from npm package: https://www.npmjs.com/package/monthpicker
It needs to be https://github.com/ddiebel/monthpicker

I'm not sure I understand why I should use a different github repository?
The module in https://github.com/ddiebel/monthpicker is a different repository.

Sorry i read that as npm package and hence got confused since the npm pacakge for that points to different repo

Can you name it jquery-monthPicker in the header instead?
Instead of disabling the lint, fix the error... this can use the union of literals where return types match

I considered doing so, but this would be a lot harder to read and not allow to add any comments. I also noticed that other jQuery definitions specify each method independently. Is there any advantage in using a union of literals that I'm not aware of?
When the comments are added you can add the lint disable comments and add the comments. without comments it makes no sense to have overloads. We prefer union over overloads.
I have already added the comments.
